DataElement.preferredName: Tumor Involvement Superior Mesenteric Artery Or Celiac Axis Yes No Not Evaluable Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no/not evaluable indicator related to a benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation that has a connection to the superior mesenteric artery or celiac axis.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Tumor Involvement Superior Mesenteric Artery Or Celiac Axis
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias._To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process._An artery arising from the abdominal aorta with numerous branches that supply the intestines from the duodenum to the transverse colon and the pancreas._An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise._A major abdominal artery that arises from the abdominal aorta below the diaphragm.  It supplies blood to the digestive organs. It has three major branches, left gastric artery, common hepatic artery, and splenic artery._A straight line through a body or figure that satisfies certain conditions.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

It supplies blood to the digestive organs. It has three major branches, left gastric artery, common hepatic artery, and splenic artery.:A straight line through a body or figure that satisfies certain conditions.:To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

Concepts.definition: An artery arising from the abdominal aorta with numerous branches that supply the intestines from the duodenum to the transverse colon and the pancreas.

An article used to connect words, phrases, or clauses representing alternatives; used to connect alternative terms for the same thing; used in correlation; used to correct or rephrase what was previously said; otherwise.

A major abdominal artery that arises from the abdominal aorta below the diaphragm.  It supplies blood to the digestive organs. It has three major branches, left gastric artery, common hepatic artery, and splenic artery.
A straight line through a body or figure that satisfies certain conditions.
To have a connection by participation or association or use; sharing in an activity or process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: indication of the presence and extent of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no/not evaluable.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ReferenceDocuments.name: An interface is present betwe
ReferenceDocuments.description: An interface is present between the tumor and superior mesenteric artery or celiac axis measuring less than 180 degrees of the circumference of the vessel wall
